messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Blogging???
messages.msgSnippet: I figure you already got a decent number of definitions by now, so I ll just include a few references for your amusement. Wikipedia has a great entry on blogs
messages.messageBody:
I figure you already got a decent number of definitions by now, so I'll just
include a few references for your amusement.

Wikipedia has a great entry on blogs here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blog
Here is a blog that is showcasing a set of other blogs on homeschooling:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blog
Here's an article that gives a good overview of what you can do with blogs:
http://www.lewrockwell.com/north/north374.html
And of course, if you want to get serious with blogging, ehow.com has a few
tips:
http://wiki.ehow.com/Write-a-Famous-Blog

On 1/4/06, carolyn6522 <c_argabrite@...> wrote:
>

> tell me what it is.
> Thanks alot,
> Carolyn

Daniel

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Blogging???
messages.msgSnippet: Yeah, a question I feel qualified to answer! Blogging is the verb of creating a web log , which has morphed into blog . It can be like an online diary or
messages.messageBody:
Yeah, a question I feel qualified to answer!

Blogging is the verb of creating a "web log", which has morphed into
"blog". It can be like an online diary or more like a bunch of links with
commentary, or a combination of the two. There are many free blog hosting
sites. I use http://blogger.com .

Nancy Reeves
http://lillily.blogspot.com

Hi Carolyn...

A blog is an online journal. Mine is in my signature if you want to
check it out. The one I use if free and very easy. Why not sign up
and just start one? They're kinda fun!

~ Joanne ~
